  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9.7</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="34%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:34.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cases</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">615</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">648</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">750</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(13.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is a leading producer and
supplier of rum, brandy, wine and spirits to other beverage alcohol
manufacturers; produces, imports and markets premium branded spirits; bottles
beverage alcohol and other beverages on a contract basis and under its own
labels; and produces vinegar and cooking wine.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s net sales and gross margins
(gross profit as a percentage of net sales) vary depending on the mix of
business among the Company&#146;s products.&#160;
Historically, gross margins have been highest in bulk alcohol products
and premium branded spirits and lower in bottling operations and vinegar and
cooking wine operations.&#160; Within its
bottling operations, sales and gross margins have varied substantially based
upon the mix of business from the Company&#146;s &#147;Type A&#148; and &#147;Type B&#148; bottling
customers.&#160; Type A bottling customers
pay the Company to purchase their raw materials and these costs are passed
through to the customer.&#160; Type B
bottling customers supply their own raw materials and are only charged for
bottling charges.&#160; Although gross profit
per case for the Company&#146;s Type A and Type B bottling customers is
approximately equal, given the same case volume, net sales and cost of goods
sold with respect to products bottled for Type A bottling customers are higher,
and gross margins are lower, than for Type B bottling customers.&#160; As a result, significant fluctuations in
volume of Type A bottling customers can distort the Company&#146;s gross margin.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The size and timing of purchase orders and
product shipments can cause operating results to fluctuate significantly from
quarter to quarter, particularly since some customers purchase bulk alcohol
products in significant quantities or place significant orders for contract
bottling services, distilled spirits, vinegar and cooking wine.&#160; Additionally, some Company products generate
higher profit margins than others, and changes in the Company&#146;s product mix
will therefore cause gross margins to fluctuate.&#160; Certain aspects of the Company&#146;s business are also seasonal, with
increased demand for the Company&#146;s contract bottling services from
April&nbsp;to October&nbsp;and increased production of the Company&#146;s bulk
alcohol products from November&nbsp;to June, corresponding to the Florida
citrus-harvest.&#160; As a result of these
factors, the Company&#146;s operating results may vary significantly from quarter to
quarter.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales represent the Company&#146;s gross sales
less excise taxes. Excise taxes are generally payable on products bottled by
the Company.&#160; In addition, excise taxes
are payable on sales of industrial alcohol to certain customers.&#160; Accordingly, excise taxes vary from period
to period depending upon the Company&#146;s product and customer mix.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Results of Operations</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Fiscal 2003 Compared to Fiscal 2002</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2002, net
sales and cost of goods sold of premium branded spirits included excise taxes
of approximately $2.9 million, representing excise taxes included in cases sold
from warehouses located outside of the Company&#146;s </font>Florida bonded warehouse facilities. Beginning
October&nbsp;1, 2002, the Company no longer includes excise taxes in net sales
and cost of goods sold of premium branded spirits case sales from locations
outside of the Company&#146;s Florida bonded warehouse facilities.&#160; Net sales and cost of sales in 2002 have
been reclassified to conform to the 2003 presentation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Net
Sales.</font></i></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>Net
sales were $90.4 million in 2003 and $96.8 million in 2002.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales of bulk alcohol products were $35.2
million in 2003, a decrease of 0.7% from net sales of $35.4 million in 2002.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales of premium branded spirits were
$20.8 million in 2003, a decrease of 4.5% from net sales of $21.8 million in 2002.&#160; In 2002, net sales of premium branded
spirits included $1.9 million of bulk tequila sales and $1.5 million of new
Cruzan ready-to-drink products. Bulk tequila sales represent the liquidation of
inventory that was held to produce Porfidio tequila. During the third quarter of
2002, the Company introduced a new line of Cruzan products in the
ready-to-drink category, sales of which are included in the Company&#146;s premium
branded spirits segment. The Company sold approximately 134,000 cases of this
new product, representing net sales of $1.5 million through September&nbsp;30,
2002.&#160; During 2003, due to increased
competition and management&#146;s expectation of limited growth potential within the
ready-to-drink product category, the Company made a strategic decision to exit
this category and concentrate on the growing segment of its premium branded
spirits business, Cruzan Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums.&#160; In connection with management&#146;s decision to
exit the ready-to-drink product category, during the fourth quarter of 2003,
the Company entered into an agreement with a corporate trading company to
receive trade credits upon installment deliveries of the Company&#146;s remaining
inventory of ready-to-drink products.&#160;
During the fourth quarter of 2003, sales of the Company&#146;s ready-to-drink
products were $1.0 million.&#160; See note 5
to the consolidated financial statements for more information about the
Company&#146;s remaining inventory of ready-to-drink products.&#160; Excluding bulk tequila and Cruzan
ready-to-drink product sales, net sales of premium branded spirits were $19.8
million in 2003, an increase of 8.4% from net sales of $18.3 million in
2002.&#160; Sales of the Company&#146;s Cruzan
Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums increased 13.5% in 2003 compared to 2002.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales of the Company&#146;s bottling
operations were $14.3 million in 2003, a decrease of 23.5% from net sales of
$18.7 million in 2002.&#160; The unit volume
of the Company&#146;s bottling operations decreased 32.7% in 2003 as a result of the
decision of a large bottling customer to shift production from the Company to its
own bottling facilities.&#160; During Fiscal
2002, this customer represented approximately 48% of the Company&#146;s unit volume
in bottling operations.&#160; During the
third quarter of Fiscal 2003, management implemented a plan to consolidate the
Company&#146;s bottling operations to increase efficiencies and reduce overhead in
the future.&#160; Management expects to
realize cost savings from this plan beginning in the first quarter of fiscal
2004, with these cost savings increasing in the second, third and fourth
quarters of fiscal 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales of vinegar and cooking wine were
$20.2 million in 2003, a decrease of 3.8% from net sales of $21.0 million in
2002.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Gross
Profit.</font></i></b> Gross profit was $29.3 million in 2003, a
decrease of 6.0% from gross profit of $31.1 million in 2002.&#160; Gross margin increased to 32.4% in 2003 from
32.2% in 2002.&#160; In 2002, gross profit
included approximately $0.5 million related to the liquidation sale of bulk
tequila, and $0.2 million related to the sale of ready-to-drink products.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Selling,
General and Administrative Expenses.</font></i></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">&#160; </font></i>Selling,
general and administrative expenses were $23.2 million in 2003, an increase of
3.0% from $22.5 million in 2002.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating
Income.</font></i></b>&#160;
The following table sets forth the operating income (loss) by operating
segment of the Company for 2003
and 2002 and the percent change for the periods.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.68%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">11,432</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

 </tr>

  <td width="52%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.7%;">

  </td>

  Operations</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(8.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.1%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="52%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.7%;">

  Operations and Other</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="color:black;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.2%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(6,339</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.2%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.1%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="52%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:52.7%;">
  <p style="color:black;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="color:black;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.68%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">6,065</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="color:black;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.68%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">8,600</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.2%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.2%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(29.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.1%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the above factors, operating income was $6.1 million in
2003, a decrease of 29.5% from operating income of $8.6 million in 2002.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s premium branded spirits segment
experienced operating losses of $2.3 million in 2003 and $0.3 million in
2002.&#160; The operating losses reflected
the Company&#146;s continuing efforts to increase market share by reinvesting
segment gross profits in selling and marketing expenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s bottling operations segment reported an operating loss of $1.9
million in 2003 compared to operating income of $0.1 million in 2002. The
operating loss reflected the decision of a large bottling customer to shift
production from the Company to its own bottling facilities.&#160; This customer represented approximately 48% of
the Company&#146;s annual bottling operations unit volume for fiscal year 2002.&#160; During the third quarter of Fiscal 2003,
management implemented a plan to consolidate the Company&#146;s bottling operations
to increase efficiencies and reduce overhead in the future.&#160; Management expects to realize cost savings
from this plan beginning in the first quarter of fiscal 2004, with these cost
savings increasing in the second, third and fourth quarters of fiscal 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Interest
Expense.</font></i></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>Interest
expense was $3.4 million in 2003 and $3.1 million in 2002.&#160; The net increase in interest expense was a
result of higher interest rates during 2003 as compared to 2002, the payment of
$296,250 in amendment fees during 2003, partially offset by lower average
borrowings.&#160; The Company&#146;s interest rate
under the term-loan and revolving credit agreement was increased 50 basis
points effective January&nbsp;1, 2003 and an additional 50 basis points
effective May&nbsp;14, 2003.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other
Expense</font></i>.</b>&#160;
On November&nbsp;26, 2002, the Company announced the retirement and
resignation of A. Kenneth Pincourt, Jr., its Founder, Chairman and Chief
Executive Officer.&#160; The Company entered
into a retirement agreement with Mr. Pincourt, setting forth the terms of his
retirement and resignation.&#160; The
retirement agreement replaces Mr. Pincourt&#146;s previous employment agreement.
Under the retirement agreement, the Company elected to accelerate retirement
benefits under its deferred compensation program and to continue to pay
compensation and provide related benefits through July&nbsp;15, 2004, the
remaining term of Mr. Pincourt&#146;s previous employment contract.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Accelerated benefits under the deferred
program amounted to $1,040,987, of which $549,220 had been accrued as of
September&nbsp;30, 2002. Mr. Pincourt&#146;s deferred compensation was paid to him
on December&nbsp;13, 2002.&#160; Also under
the retirement agreement, Mr. Pincourt will continue to receive monthly
payments of $41,004 through July&nbsp;15, 2004, one bonus payment of $150,491
which was paid in October&nbsp;2003, and a second bonus payment of $119,138
payable on or before August&nbsp;31, 2004.&#160;
Among other benefits, Mr. Pincourt is also able to participate in any
health insurance plan, employee benefit plan or other arrangement made
available by the Company or its subsidiaries to its executives and key
management employees, through July&nbsp;15, 2004.&#160; The Company recorded a charge for the retirement of Mr. Pincourt
during the first quarter of Fiscal 2003.&#160;
The effect of this charge was included in other expense in the Company&#146;s
consolidated statement of income and amounted to $1,503,925 before income taxes.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='12',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table summarizes the charge
made during the first quarter of Fiscal 2003 for Mr. Pincourt&#146;s retirement:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="69%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:.6in;width:69.98%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="75%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:75.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred compensation</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.84%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="19%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:19.28%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,040,987</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="75%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:75.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Compensation and related benefits</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="21%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:21.12%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,012,158</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="75%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:75.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Total</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="21%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:21.12%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,053,145</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="75%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:75.38%;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="21%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:21.12%;">
  <p align="right" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="75%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:75.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Less deferred compensation accrued as of</font>&#160; September&nbsp;30,
  2002</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(549,220</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="75%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:75.38%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Charged to expense</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.84%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="19%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:19.26%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,503,925</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;22, 2003, the Company announced
the retirement of Troy Edwards, its Chief Financial Officer, Secretary, Treasurer
and Controller.&#160; The Company recorded a
charge for the retirement of Mr. Edwards of $207,683 during the third quarter
of Fiscal 2003.&#160; The effect of this
charge was included in other expense in the Company&#146;s consolidated statement of
income.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income
Tax Expense.</font></i></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>The
Company&#146;s effective income tax rate was 17.1% in 2002.&#160; The low tax rate was attributable to a 90%
exemption of the Company&#146;s Virgin Islands subsidiary from U.S. Virgin Islands
income taxes.&#160; The exemption is
effective through September&nbsp;2020.&#160;
In addition, the Company benefited from the extraterritorial income
exclusion in 2003 and 2002.&#160; During
2003, the Company incurred operating losses from its U.S. operations and
recorded an income tax benefit of $1.3 million.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Fiscal 2002 Compared to Fiscal 2001</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2002 and
2001, net sales and cost of goods sold of premium branded spirits included
excise taxes of approximately $2.9 million and $2.5 million, respectively,
representing excise taxes included in cases sold from warehouses located
outside of the Company&#146;s Florida bonded warehouse facilities. Beginning
October&nbsp;1, 2002, the Company no longer includes excise taxes in net sales
and cost of goods sold of premium branded spirits case sales from </font>locations outside of the Company&#146;s Florida bonded warehouse
facilities.&#160; Net sales and cost of sales
in 2002 and 2001 have been reclassified to conform to the 2003 presentation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Net
Sales.</font></i></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>Net
sales were $96.8 million in 2002 and $97.3 million in 2001.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales of bulk alcohol products were $35.4
million in 2002, a decrease of 10.8% from net sales of $39.7 million in 2001.
The decrease resulted primarily from decreased sales of citrus brandy, citrus
spirits, rum and fortified wine. The Company&#146;s bulk alcohol product sales have
declined primarily due to increased competition.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales of premium branded spirits were
$21.8 million in 2002, an increase of 35.9% from net sales of $16.0 million in
2001.&#160; In 2002, net sales of premium
branded spirits included $1.9 million of bulk tequila sales and $1.5 million of
new Cruzan ready-to-drink products. Bulk tequila sales represent the
liquidation of inventory that was held to produce Porfidio tequila. During the
third quarter of 2002, the Company introduced a new line of Cruzan products in
the ready-to-drink category, sales of which are included in the Company&#146;s
premium branded spirits segment. The Company sold approximately 134,000 cases
of this new product, representing net sales of $1.5 million through
September&nbsp;30, 2002.&#160; Excluding bulk
tequila and Cruzan ready-to-drink product sales, net sales of premium branded
spirits were $18.3 million in 2002, an increase of 14.2% from net sales of
$16.0 million in 2001.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sales of the Company&#146;s Cruzan Estate Rums and
Cruzan Flavored Rums increased $0.7 million and $4.1 million, or 20.3% and 59.3%, respectively, in 2002 compared to
2001.&#160; These sales increases were
partially offset by a decrease in sales of Porfidio tequila. Sales of Porfidio
tequila were $1.5 million in 2001. However, the decrease in sales of Porfidio
tequila has not had a material adverse effect on the Company&#146;s consolidated
results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales of the Company&#146;s bottling
operations were $18.7 million in 2002, a decrease of 9.6% from net sales of
$20.6 million in 2001.&#160; The unit volume
of the Company&#146;s bottling operations decreased 12.2% in 2002 as a result of decreased business with a
large contract bottling customer.&#160; In
addition, during 2002, one of the Company&#146;s major contract bottling customers
decided to shift production from the Company to its own bottling
facilites.&#160; This customer represented
approximately 48% of the Company&#146;s 2002 unit volume in bottling operations.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales of vinegar and cooking wine were
$21.0 million in 2002, an increase of 0.5% from net sales of $20.9 million in
2001.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Gross
Profit.</font></i></b> Gross profit was $31.1 million in 2002, a
decrease of 2.9% from gross profit of $32.1 million in 2001.&#160; Gross margin decreased to 31.2% in 2002 from
32.2% in 2001.&#160; The decrease in gross
margin was primarily attributable to a change in product mix as the unit volume
of higher margin bulk alcohol products declined.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Selling,
General and Administrative Expenses.</font></i></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">&#160; </font></i>Selling,
general and administrative expenses were $22.5 million in 2002, an increase of
9.8% from $20.5 million in 2001.&#160;
Effective October&nbsp;1, 2001, the Company adopted SFAS 142, which
requires that goodwill and certain other intangible assets no longer be
amortized. There was no goodwill amortization in 2002 compared to $1.3 million
in 2001. Excluding goodwill amortization in 2001, selling, general and
administrative expenses were $22.5 million in 2002, an increase of 17.1% from
$19.2 million in 2001.&#160;&#160; The increase
was primarily attributable to increased selling, general and administrative
expenses related to the Company&#146;s premium branded spirits business of $1.9
million, which included increased marketing expenses of $1.1 million and $0.3
million of non-recurring legal expenses, and increased corporate overhead of
$1.0 million, which included increases in insurance, personnel costs and $0.4
million of non-recurring taxes and forfeitures related to the BATF settlement
with respect to export shipments of bulk alcohol products (see Note 19 to the
consolidated financial statements).</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating
Income.</font></i></b>&#160;
The following table sets forth the operating income (loss) by operating
segment of the Company for 2002
and 2001 and the percent change for the periods.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.4%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">10,539</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.32%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.4%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">12,781</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.32%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.92%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(17.5</font></p>

  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.92%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.14%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="50%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:50.14%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.32%;">
  <p style="color:black;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.4%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">8,600</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.32%;">
  <p style="color:black;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.52%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.4%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">11,549</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.32%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.92%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(25.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.14%;">
  <p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the above factors, operating income was $8.6 million in
2002, a decrease of 25.5% from operating income of $11.5 million in 2001.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s premium branded spirits segment
experienced operating losses of $0.3 million in 2002 and $0.8 million in
2001.&#160; The operating losses reflected
the Company&#146;s continuing efforts to increase market share by reinvesting segment gross profits in
selling and marketing expenses, as well as legal expenses and decreased sales
of Porfidio tequila discussed above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Interest
Expense.</font></i></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>Interest
expense was $3.1 million in 2002 and $4.9 million in 2001.&#160; The decrease in interest expense was due to a lower average debt level and lower
interest rates during 2002 compared to 2001.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income
Tax Expense.</font></i></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">  </font></i>The
Company&#146;s effective income tax rate was 17.1% in 2002 and 20.1% in 2001.&#160; The low tax rate was attributable to a 90%
exemption of the Company&#146;s Virgin Islands subsidiary from U.S. Virgin Islands income taxes.&#160; The exemption is effective through
September&nbsp;2020 (see Note 10 to the Consolidated Financial
Statements).&#160; In addition, in 2002 and
2001 the Company benefited from the new Extraterritorial Income Exclusion.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Financial
Liquidity and Capital Resources</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">General</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s principal use of cash in its
operating activities is for purchasing raw materials to be used in its
manufacturing operations and purchasing imported products for its premium
branded spirits business.&#160; The Company&#146;s source of liquidity has
historically been cash flow from operations and its line of credit.&#160; Some of the Company&#146;s manufacturing
operations are seasonal and the Company&#146;s borrowings on its line of credit vary
during</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='14',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">the year.&#160; For example, the
Company uses citrus molasses as its primary raw material in the production of
citrus brandy and spirits at its two Florida distilleries.&#160; The Company buys citrus molasses, a
byproduct of citrus juice production, from manufacturers of citrus juice
concentrate during the citrus harvest, which generally runs from
November&nbsp;to June.&#160; The Company
generally begins purchasing citrus molasses in November&nbsp;and manufactures
and builds inventory of citrus brandy and spirits.&#160; The Company manufactures and builds inventory while raw materials
are available due to the short life of the citrus molasses it purchases.&#160; Another seasonal business of the Company is
its contract bottling services.&#160; Demand
for contract bottling services is highest from April&nbsp;through October.&#160; Management believes that cash provided by
its operating and financing activities will provide adequate resources to
satisfy its working capital, liquidity and anticipated capital expenditure
requirements for both its short-term and long-term capital needs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Operating Activities</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash provided by operating activities in
2003 was $7.5 million, which resulted from $8.6 million in net income adjusted for noncash items, and
a $1.1 million net change in operating assets and liabilities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Investing and Financing Activities</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash used in investing activities in 2003
was $0.9 million, including capital expenditures of $3.4 million partially offset by a net
redemption of short-term investments of $2.3 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash used in financing activities in 2003
was $5.6 million, which resulted primarily from a $1.5 million decrease in borrowings under the
revolving credit facility and $4.2 million of payments on long-term debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October&nbsp;2001, the Company&#146;s previous
long-term debt and line of credit were replaced with a $70 million credit agreement between the
Company and a syndicate of lenders.&#160; The
current credit agreement consists of&#160;
(1) a $30 million revolving credit facility which expires in
October&nbsp;2004, and (2) a term loan with an initial amount of $40 million
which matures on September&nbsp;30, 2006.&#160;
See Note 9 to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements for
additional information related to the Company&#146;s long-term debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2002 and
March&nbsp;31, 2003, the Company was not in compliance with the Funded Debt to
EBITDA (earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization)
financial covenant under its credit agreement.&#160;
In addition, as of March&nbsp;31, 2003 the Company was not in compliance
with its Interest Coverage and Fixed Charge Coverage financial covenants.&#160; On February&nbsp;18, 2003, the Company
received a waiver for the December&nbsp;31, 2002 covenant violation.&#160; On May&nbsp;14, 2003, the Company received a
waiver of the March&nbsp;31, 2003 covenant violations and amended the credit
agreement prospectively to reset the levels of certain financial covenants to
reflect the Company&#146;s current business plan and forecasts.&#160; The Company paid a fee of $136,250 for the
December&nbsp;waiver and $160,000 for the March&nbsp;waiver and amendment.&#160; The Company&#146;s interest rate under the
term-loan and revolving credit agreement was increased 50 basis points
effective January&nbsp;1, 2003 and an additional 50 basis points effective
May&nbsp;14, 2003.&#160; As of
September&nbsp;30, 2003, the Company was in compliance with all financial
covenants.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s bank debt was $51.0 million as
of September&nbsp;30, 2003, and its ratio of total debt to equity was 0.97 to 1.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s share of the undistributed
earnings of its Bahamian and Virgin Islands subsidiaries was approximately $7.3
million and $31.6 million, respectively, as of September&nbsp;30, 2003.&#160; No provision has been made for taxes which
would result from the remittance of such undistributed earnings, as the Company
intends to reinvest these earnings indefinitely. See Note 10 to the Company&#146;s
consolidated financial statements for additional information on income taxes
related to these subsidiaries.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based on current plans and business
conditions, management expects that its cash and cash equivalents, together
with any amounts generated from operations and available borrowings, will be
sufficient to meet the Company&#146;s cash requirements for at least the next 12
months.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='15',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Critical Accounting Policies</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The&#160;
Company&#146;s&#160; significant accounting
policies are more fully described in Note &#160;1&#160; to the Company&#146;s
consolidated financial statements located in Item 8 of this&#160; Annual&#160;
Report&#160; on Form 10-K. The
preparation of financial statements in conformity with accounting principles
generally accepted in the United States of America requires management to make
estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets,
liabilities, revenues, and expenses, and the related disclosures of contingent
assets and liabilities. Actual results could differ from those estimates under
different assumptions or conditions. The Company believes that the following
critical accounting policy is subject to estimates and judgments used in the
preparation of its consolidated financial statements:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has goodwill and intangible
assets associated with business acquisitions. The Company reviews these assets
for impairment annually and whenever an event occurs or circumstances change
that would more likely than not reduce the fair value of these assets below
their carrying value. If the fair value of these assets is less than their
carrying value, then an impairment loss would be recognized equal to the excess
of the carrying value over the fair value of the asset.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Off Balance Sheet Arrangements</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has no off-balance sheet
arrangements that have or are reasonably likely to have a current or future
effect on the Company&#146;s financial condition, changes in financial condition,
revenues or expenses, results of operations, liquidity, capital expenditures or
capital resources that are material to investors.&#160; See Recent Accounting Pronouncements, below.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Recent Accounting Pronouncements</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of March&nbsp;31, 2003, the Company
adopted Financial Accounting Standards Board Intepretation No. 45 (&#147;FIN 45&#148;), <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Guarantor&#146;s Accounting and Disclosure Requirements
for Guarantees, Including Indirect Guarantees of Indebtedness of Others</font></i>.&#160; FIN 45 requires a guarantor to recognize at
the inception of a guarantee, a liability for the fair value or market value,
of the obligation undertaken in issuing the guarantee and must disclose the
information in its interim and annual financial statements.&#160; The provisions related to recognizing a
liability at inception for the fair value&#160;
of the guarantor&#146;s obligation does not apply to guarantees issued
between entities under common control and therefore is not applicable to the
Company.&#160; Management believes that this
standard does not have a material effect on the Company&#146;s consolidated
financial position or results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;2003, the Financial
Accounting Standards Board issued FIN 46, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Consolidation
of Variable Interest Entities.&#160; </font></i>FIN
46 clarifies the application of Accounting Research Bulletin 51, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Consolidated Financial Statements</font></i>, for
certain entities that do not have sufficient equity at risk for the entity to
finance its activities wihout additional subordinated financial support from
other parties or in which equity investors do not have the characteristics of a
controlling financial interest (&#147;variable interest entities&#148;).&#160; Variable interest entities within the scope
of FIN 46 will be required to be consolidated by their primary
beneficiary.&#160; The primary beneficiary of
a variable interest entity is determined to be the party that absorbs a
majority of the entity&#146;s expected losses, receives a majority of its expected
returns, or both.&#160; FIN 46 applied
immediately to variable interest entities created after January&nbsp;31, 2003,
and to variable interest entities in which the Company obtains an interest
after that date.&#160; FIN 46 was effective
July&nbsp;1, 2003 to variable interest entities in which the Company holds a
variable interest that it acquired before February&nbsp;1, 2003.&#160; Management believes this standard does not
have a material effect on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position or
results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Retirement of Chairman and Chief Executive
Officer and Chief Financial Officer</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
November&nbsp;2002, the Company announced the retirement of A. Kenneth
Pincourt, Jr., its Founder, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer.&#160; The Company entered into an agreement with
Mr. Pincourt, setting forth the terms of his retirement.&#160; Under this agreement, the Company elected to
accelerate retirement benefits and continue to pay compensation and provide
related benefits through July&nbsp;15, 2004.&#160;
The Company recorded a charge for these items during the first quarter
of its 2003 fiscal year.&#160; The effect of
this charge, net of income tax benefits, was approximately $1&nbsp;million or
$.18 per common share.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='16',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On
May&nbsp;22, 2003, the Company announced the retirement of Troy Edwards, its
Chief Financial Officer, Secretary, Treasurer and Controller.&#160; The Company recorded a charge for the
retirement of Mr. Edwards of $207,683 during the third quarter of Fiscal 2003.&#160; The effect of this charge was included in
other expense in the Company&#146;s consolidated statement of income.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Effects of Inflation and Changing Prices</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s results of operations and
financial condition have not been significantly affected by inflation and
changing prices.&#160; The Company has been
able, subject to normal competitive conditions, to pass along rising costs
through increased selling prices.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item 7A.&#160;
Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
