</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.5pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company carries certain variable rate
debt and thus is exposed to the impact of interest rate changes.&#160; The table above summarizes the Company&#146;s market
risk associated with debt obligations as of September&nbsp;30, 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the event of an adverse change in interest
rates, management would likely take certain actions to further mitigate the
Company&#146;s exposure.&#160; However, due to the
uncertainty of the actions that would be taken and their possible effects, this
analysis assumes no such actions.&#160; The
Company had no financial instruments or derivative financial instruments held
for trading purposes as of September&nbsp;30, 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">See Note 9 to the Company&#146;s consolidated
financial statements for additional information related to Company&#146;s financing
arrangements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
8.&#160; Financial Statements and
Supplementary Data</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The consolidated financial statements and
financial statement schedules of the Company and its subsidiaries, and the
report of independent auditors, are listed at Item&nbsp;15.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
9.&#160; Changes in and Disagreements with
Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
9A.&#160; Disclosure Controls and Procedures</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Evaluation
of Disclosure Controls and Procedures</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company maintains disclosure controls and
procedures (as defined in Rule 13a-15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of
1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;) that are designed to ensure that
information required to be disclosed in the Company&#146;s reports under the
Exchange Act are recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time
periods specified in the SEC&#146;s rules and forms, and that the information is
accumulated and communicated to the Company&#146;s management, including the Company&#146;s
Chief Executive Officer and Chief</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">17</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='17',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financial Officer, as appropriate, to allow timely decisions regarding
required disclosure.&#160; In designing and
evaluating the disclosure controls and procedures, management recognized that
any disclosure controls and procedures, no matter how well designed and
operated, can provide only reasonable assurance of achieving the desired
objectives, and management was required to apply its judgment in evaluating the
cost-benefit relationship of possible disclosure controls and procedures.&#160; The Company&#146;s management, with the
participation of the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial
Officer, has evaluated the effectiveness of the design and operation of the Company&#146;s
disclosure controls and procedures as of the end of the period covered by this
report.&#160; Based upon that evaluation and
subject to the foregoing, the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer and Chief
Financial Officer concluded that the design and operation of the Company&#146;s
disclosure controls and procedures provided reasonable assurance that the
disclosure controls and procedures are effective to accomplish their
objectives.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Changes
in Internal Controls Over Financial Reporting</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
addition, management, including the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer and Chief
Financial Officer, reviewed the Company&#146;s internal control over financial
reporting (as defined in Rule 13a-15(f) under the Exchange Act), and there have
been no significant changes in the Company&#146;s internal controls or in other
factors that could significantly affect those controls over financial reporting
during the period covered by this report.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='18',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PART III</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
10.&#160; Directors and Executive Officers of
the Registrant</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The information required by Item 10 is
incorporated by reference from the Company&#146;s definitive proxy statement for its
2004 annual stockholders&#146; meeting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
11.&#160; Executive Compensation</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The information required by Item 11 is incorporated
by reference from the Company&#146;s definitive proxy statement for its 2004 annual
stockholders&#146; meeting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Item
12.&#160; Security Ownership of Certain
Beneficial Owners and Management</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.54%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8.26</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.12%;">
  <p align="right" style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

  <td width="17%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:17.48%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">853,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.26%;">

</font></div>


<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>All of the shares
reported in this row reflect stock options granted under the Company&#146;s 1992
Employee Stock Option Plan, as amended.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

incorporated by reference from the Company&#146;s definitive proxy statement for its
2004 annual stockholders&#146; meeting.</font></p>

  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:4.38%;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">22</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><img border="0" width="248" height="88" src="g62881beimage002.gif"></font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><a name="IndependentAuditorsReport"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Independent
Auditor&#146;s Report</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To the Board of Directors and Stockholders</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Todhunter International, Inc.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">West Palm Beach, Florida</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of
Todhunter International, Inc. and subsidiaries as of September&nbsp;30, 2003
and 2002, and the related consolidated statements of income, comprehensive
income, stockholders&#146; equity and cash flows for each of the three years in the
period ended September&nbsp;30, 2003.&#160;
These financial statements are the responsibility of the Company&#146;s
management.&#160; Our responsibility is to
express an opinion on these financial statements based on our audits.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We conducted our audits in accordance with auditing standards generally
accepted in the United States of America.&#160;
Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain
reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of
material misstatement.&#160; An audit
includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and
disclosures in the financial statements.&#160;
An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and
significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall
financial statement presentation.&#160; We
believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements referred to above
present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of Todhunter
International, Inc. and subsidiaries as of September&nbsp;30, 2003 and 2002,
and the results of their operations and their cash flows for each of the three
years in the period ended September&nbsp;30, 2003 in conformity with accounting
principles generally accepted in the United States of America.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

</font>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2002</font></b></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,465,758</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="57%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:57.0%;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">See Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">30</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">TODHUNTER INTERNATIONAL, INC. AND
SUBSIDIARIES</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><a name="NotesToConsolidatedFinancialStatemen"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .8in;text-indent:-.8in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
1.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Nature
of Business and Significant Accounting Policies</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nature of business</font></u>:&#160; Todhunter
International, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;), is a leading producer and supplier of rum,
brandy, wine and spirits to other beverage alcohol manufacturers; produces,
imports and markets premium branded spirits; bottles beverage alcohol and other
beverages on a contract basis and under its own labels; and produces vinegar
and cooking wine.&#160; The Company operates
four production facilities in the United States and one in St. Croix, United
States Virgin Islands and purchases certain products for resale.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ownership</font></u>:&#160; On January&nbsp;31, 2003, Angostura Limited
(&#147;Angostura&#148;), a Trinidad-based distiller, has reported that, as a result of
open market and private purchases, it beneficially owned shares representing
approximately 64% of the Company&#146;s common stock.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A summary of the Company&#146;s significant accounting policies follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Principles of consolidation</font></u>:&#160; The consolidated financial statements
include the accounts of Todhunter International, Inc. and all of its
majority-owned subsidiaries.&#160; All
significant intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated in
consolidation.&#160; Investments in business
entities in which the Company does not have control, but has the ability to
exercise significant influence over operating and financial policies (generally
20-50% ownership), are accounted for by the equity method.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Accounting estimates</font></u>:&#160; The preparation of financial statements
requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported
amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and
liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of
revenues and expenses during the reporting period.&#160; Actual results could differ from those estimates.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenue recognition</font></u>:&#160; The Company recognizes revenue when its
product is shipped, at which time title passes to the customer.&#160; Revenues from contract bottling services are
recognized at the time the bottling process is completed.&#160; Excise taxes on products sold are billed
directly to customers and are included in sales at the same time the product
sold is recognized as revenue.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash equivalents</font></u>:&#160; The Company considers certificates of
deposit and other short-term investments with an original maturity of three
months or less to be cash equivalents.&#160;
The Company maintains depository accounts in excess of FDIC insured
limits.&#160; The Company has not experienced
any credit losses in such accounts and does not anticipate any losses.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Short-term investments</font></u>:&#160; The Company has investments in certificates
of deposit and commercial paper, which mature within one year of purchase.&#160; All of the Company&#146;s short-term investments
are classified as held-to-maturity and are carried at amortized cost.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trade receivables</font></u>:&#160; The Company records trade receivables at
cost, which approximates fair value at the respective balance sheet dates. &#160;The Company estimates its allowance for
doubtful accounts based on a combination of historical and current information
regarding the balance of trade receivables, as well as the current composition
of the pool of trade receivables.&#160; The
Company determines status on trade receivables based on the contractual terms
of the original sale.&#160; Trade receivables
that management believes to be uncollectible are written off upon such
determination.&#160; Recoveries of accounts
receivable previously written off are recorded when received.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Inventories</font></u>:&#160; Inventories are stated at the lower of cost
or market.&#160; Cost is determined using the
first-in, first-out method.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Property and equipment</font></u>:&#160; Property and equipment is stated at
cost.&#160; Depreciation is calculated on the
straight-line method over the estimated useful lives of the various classes of
depreciable assets.&#160; Estimated lives are
as follows:</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="80%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:20.15pt;width:80.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="72%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:72.72%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.56%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Years</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.96%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="72%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:72.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Land improvements</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.56%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3 to 20</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="72%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:72.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Buildings and improvements</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.56%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3 to 40</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="72%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:72.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Machinery and equipment</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.56%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3 to 33</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.96%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trademarks</font></u>:&#160; Amortization on trademarks held are computed
on the straight-line basis over the estimated lives of the trademarks.&#160; Estimated lives are twenty to forty years.&#160; (See Note 7)</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred loan costs</font></u>:&#160; Amortization is computed using the effective
interest method over the term of the loan.&#160;
These costs are included in other assets in the accompanying
consolidated balance sheet as follows:</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Impairment of long-lived assets</font></u>:&#160; As of October&nbsp;1, 2002, the Company
adopted Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 144, (&#147;SFAS 144&#148;), <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for the Impairment or Disposal of
Long-Lived Assets</font></i>.&#160; This
Statement supersedes SFAS 121, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting
for the Impairment of Long-Lived Assets and for Long-Lived </font></i><i><font style="font-style:italic;">Assets to be Disposed Of</font></i> and the accounting and reporting provisions
of Accounting Principles Board Opinion No.&nbsp;30, Reporting the Results of
Operations-Reporting the Effects of Disposal of a Segment of a Business, and
Extraordinary, Unusual and Infrequently Occurring Events and Transactions.&#160; SFAS 144 retains the fundamental provisions
of SFAS 121 but eliminates the requirement to allocate goodwill to
long-lived assets to be tested for impairment.&#160;
This Statement also requires discontinued operations to be carried at
the lower of cost or fair value less costs to sell and broadens the
presentation of discontinued operations to include a component of an entity
rather than a segment of a business.&#160;
Long lived assets held for use are subject to an impairment assessment
if the carrying value is no longer recoverable based upon the undiscounted
future cash flows of the asset.&#160; The
amount of impairment is the difference between the carrying amount and the fair
value of the related asset.&#160; The
Company&#146;s estimate of undiscounted cash flows indicated that such carrying amounts
were expected to be recovered.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Income taxes</font></u>:&#160; Deferred income tax assets and liabilities
are computed for differences between the financial statement and tax bases of
assets and liabilities that will result in taxable or deductible amounts in the
future based on enacted tax laws and rates applicable to the periods in which
the differences are expected to affect taxable income.&#160; Valuation allowances are established when
necessary to reduce deferred tax assets to the amount expected to be realized.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Preferred stock</font></u>:&#160; The Company has authorized 2,500,000 shares
of $.01 par value preferred stock.&#160; No
terms are stated as to dividend, liquidation or other rights applicable to
these shares.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='32',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock options</font></u>:&#160; The Company applies Accounting Principles
Board Opinion Number 25, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for
Stock Issued to Employees</font></i> (&#147;APB 25&#148;) and related interpretations in
accounting for options granted, which requires compensation expense for the
Company&#146;s options to be recognized only if the market price of the underlying
stock exceeds the exercise price on the date of grant.&#160; Accordingly, the Company has not recognized
compensation expense for its options granted after 1994.&#160; SFAS 123, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting
for Stock-Based Compensation </font></i>(&#147;SFAS 123&#148;), issued in
October&nbsp;1995, requires pro forma disclosures for option grants made after
December&nbsp;31, 1994, when accounting for stock-based compensation plans in
accordance with APB 25.&#160; As of January&nbsp;1,
2003, the Company adopted SFAS 148, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting
for Stock -Based Compensation - Transition and Disclosure</font></i>, an
amendment of FASB Statement No. 123 (&#147;SFAS 148&#148;).&#160; The standard amends SFAS 123 to provide alternative methods of
transition for voluntary change to fair value based method of accounting for
stock-based employee compensation. Additionally, SFAS 148 amends the disclosure
requirements of SFAS 123 to require disclosure in the significant accounting
policy footnote of both annual and interim financial statements of the method
of accounting for stock based compensation and the related pro-forma
disclosures when the intrinsic value method continues to be used.&#160; The Company has elected to continue
accounting for stock-based compensation using the intrinsic method. However,
the Company has adopted the new disclosure requirements specified under SFAS
148 as follows:</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If the Company had elected to recognize
compensation cost based on the fair value of the options granted at grant date
as prescribed by SFAS 123, net income and earnings per common share would have
been reduced to the pro forma amounts shown below:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>

  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2003</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">

 <tr>
  <td width="50%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:50.12%;">

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="325" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="11" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="86" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="11" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="86" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="11" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="86" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The pro forma effects are determined as if
compensation costs were recognized using the fair value based accounting
method.&#160; The fair values of options
granted during 1999 and 1998 were estimated on the date of grant using the
Black-Scholes option pricing model with the following assumptions:&#160; risk free interest rate of 4.75% and 4.75%;
expected lives of 10 years; expected volatility of 29% and 30%; and a zero percent
dividend yield.&#160; The weighted-average
fair value of options granted during 1999 and 1998 was $3.98 and $4.67,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Intangible assets</font></u>:&#160;&#160; As of October&nbsp;1, 2002 the Company
adopted SFAS 142, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Goodwill and Other
Intangible Assets</font></i> (&#147;SFAS 142&#148;).&#160;
SFAS 142 supersedes APB Opinion No. 17, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Intangible
Assets</font></i>, and requires goodwill and other intangible assets that have
an indefinite useful life to no longer be amortized; however, these assets must
be reviewed at least annually for impairment.&#160;
As required by SFAS 142, the Company has completed the goodwill
impairment test and has concluded that there was no impairment to goodwill as
of and for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2003, 2002, and 2001.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">33</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='33',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Recent Accounting Pronouncements</font></u>:&#160; As of March&nbsp;31, 2003 the Company
adopted Financial Accounting Standards Board Interpretation No. 45, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Guarantor&#146;s Accounting and Disclosure Requirements
for Guarantees, Including Indirect Guarantees of Indebtedness of Others</font></i>
(&#147;FIN 45&#148;).&#160; FIN 45 requires a guarantor
to recognize at the inception of a guarantee, a liability for the fair value or
market value, of the obligation undertaken in issuing the guarantee and must
disclose that information in its interim and annual financial statements.&#160; The provisions related to recognizing a
liability at inception for the fair value of the guarantor&#146;s obligation does
not apply to guarantees issued between entities under common control and
therefore is not applicable to the Company.&#160;
Management believes that this standard does not have a material effect
on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position or results of operations.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In January&nbsp;2003, the FASB issued FIN 46,
<i><font style="font-style:italic;">Consolidation of Variable Interest Entities</font></i>
(&#147;FIN 46&#148;).&#160; FIN 46 clarifies the
application of Accounting Research Bulletin 51, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Consolidated Financial Statements</font></i>, for certain entities that
do not have sufficient equity at risk for the entity to finance its activities
without additional subordinated financial support from other parties or in
which equity investors do not have the characteristics of a controlling
financial interest (&#147;variable interest entities&#148;). Variable interest entities
within the scope of FIN 46 will be required to be consolidated by their primary
beneficiary. The primary beneficiary of a variable interest entity is
determined to be the party that absorbs a majority of the entity&#146;s expected
losses, receives a majority of its expected returns, or both. FIN 46 applied
immediately to variable interest entities created after January&nbsp;31, 2003,
and to variable interest entities in which the Company obtains an interest
after that date. FIN 46 was effective July&nbsp;1, 2003, to variable interest
entities in which the Company holds a variable interest that it acquired before
February&nbsp;1, 2003. Management believes that this standard does not have a
material effect on the Company&#146;s consolidated financial position or results of
operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Reclassifications</font></u>:&#160; Certain amounts in the 2002 and 2001
consolidated financial statements have been reclassified to conform with the
2003 presentation with no effect on net income or stockholders&#146; equity.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .8in;text-indent:-.8in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
2.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Inventories</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.44%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="17%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:17.5%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">506,422</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.8%;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .8in;text-indent:-.8in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
5.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Trade
Credits</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2003, the Company entered into an agreement with a corporate
trading company to receive trade credits upon installment deliveries of ready
to drink beverages (&#147;products&#148;) from buyers obtained by the corporate trading
company.&#160; The Company was advanced $1,966,484
of trade credits upon commencement of the agreement.&#160; The Company shipped products with a cost basis of $1,086,271 and
earned trade credits of this same amount during the year ended
September&nbsp;30, 2003.&#160; As of
September&nbsp;30, 2003, these earned trade credits have not been utilized and
are recognized in other current assets on the accompanying consolidated balance
sheet.&#160; Earned trade credits must be
utilized by June&nbsp;30, 2008 and are subject to terms as more specifically
defined in the agreement.&#160; The Company
has a remaining commitment to deliver products under this agreement in the
amount of $880,213, which is included in inventory as of September&nbsp;30,
2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .8in;text-indent:-.8in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
6.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Property
and Equipment</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The major classifications of property and equipment as of September&nbsp;30,
2003 and 2002 are:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.46%;">

  </td>
  <td width="17%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:17.92%;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .8in;text-indent:-.8in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
7.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Amortized
Intangible Assets</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Amortized intangible assets consist of the following as of
September&nbsp;30, 2003, 2002 and 2001:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Aggregate amortization expenses were $40,200 for each of the years
ended 2003, 2002 and 2001, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">36</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .8in;text-indent:-.8in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
9.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Financing
Arrangements</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term debt consists of the following as of September&nbsp;30, 2003
and 2002:</font></p>

 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In
October&nbsp;2001, the Company entered into a $70 million credit agreement,
which consists of $40 million term loans and $30 million revolving loan
facilities.&#160; The credit agreement is
collateralized by principally all assets located in the United States of
America.&#160; The Company is restricted from
paying dividends to stockholders.&#160; Also,
the Company is required to maintain unencumbered cash or marketable securities
of $4 million at the end of each fiscal quarter and to maintain a minimum fixed
charge and interest coverage ratios among other financial covenants.&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2002 and
March&nbsp;31, 2003, the Company was not in compliance with the Funded Debt to
EBITDA (earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization)
financial covenant under its credit agreement.&#160;
In addition, as of March&nbsp;31, 2003 the Company was not in compliance
with its Interest Coverage and Fixed Charge Coverage financial covenants.&#160; On February&nbsp;18, 2003, the Company
received a waiver for the December&nbsp;31, 2002 covenant violation.&#160; On May&nbsp;14, 2003, the Company received a
waiver of the March&nbsp;31, 2003 covenant violations and amended prospectively
the credit agreement to reset the levels of certain financial covenants to
reflect the Company&#146;s current business plan and forecasts.&#160; As of September&nbsp;30, 2003, the Company
was in compliance with all financial covenants.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.75in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(ii)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In
addition to the quarterly principal payments, the Company may be required to
make additional principal payments based on results of the Company&#146;s domestic
operating profits as defined in the agreement.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">37</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</font>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">38</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Temporary differences between the financial statement carrying amounts
and tax bases of assets and liabilities that give rise to significant portions
of the deferred tax assets and liabilities relate to the following as of
September&nbsp;30, 2003 and 2002:</font></p>

has been recorded as of September&nbsp;30, 2003 or 2002.</font></p>

differed from the amounts computed by applying the statutory federal income tax
rate to income before income taxes as a result of the following for the years
ended September&nbsp;30, 2003, 2002 and 2001:</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1,090,153</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">39</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='39',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Generally, the operating income of the Company&#146;s Bahamian subsidiary is
not subject to United States income taxes as there are no income taxes in the
Commonwealth of the Bahamas.&#160; The
Company sold all of its remaining operating assets in the Bahamas in fiscal
year 2000 for $3.5 million.&#160; Certain
passive income of the Bahamian subsidiary is subject to United States income
taxes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Virgin Islands
subsidiary, through the Industrial Development Commission of the Government of
the Virgin Islands of the United States, has received a 90% exemption from
income taxes on operating income.&#160; This
exemption is effective through September&nbsp;2020.&#160; The per share effect of this exemption on earnings on a basic and
diluted basis for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2003, 2002 and 2001,
respectively, is as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="95%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:95.0%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">With respect to the Bahamian and Virgin Islands subsidiaries, no
provision has been made for taxes, which would result from the remittance of
such undistributed earnings as the Company intends to reinvest these earnings
indefinitely.&#160; The Company&#146;s share of the
undistributed earnings of the Bahamian and Virgin Islands subsidiaries was
approximately $38.9 million and $35.3 million, as of September&nbsp;30, 2003
and 2002, respectively.&#160; The
undistributed earnings of the Bahamian subsidiary have been reduced by any
previously taxed income.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note
11.</font></b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Leases</p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company occupies office space under noncancelable operating leases
which expire between September&nbsp;2004 and December&nbsp;2006.&#160; One of the leases contains two renewal
options of five years each.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Future minimum lease payments under these noncancelable operating
leases as of September&nbsp;30, 2003 are as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="83%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:83.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Year Ending<br>
  September&nbsp;30,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.16%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.02%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Amount</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.08%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="83%" valign="top" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:83.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2004</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.16%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-top:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.72%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">436,032</font></p>
  </td>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,328,004</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.08%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rent expense for office space (including the Company&#146;s share of common
area expenses, real estate and sales taxes) amounted to $484,782, $485,206 and
$400,538 for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2003, 2002 and 2001,
respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">40</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='40',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .8in;text-indent:-.8in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
12.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Stock
Options</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On August&nbsp;11, 1992, the Company adopted a stock option plan for
the grant of options to key employees.&#160;
Option prices may not be less than 85% of the fair market value of the
Company&#146;s common stock on the date of grant for nonqualified options or 100% of
such fair market value for qualified stock options.&#160; As of September&nbsp;30, 2003, 853,000 shares are reserved for
issuance under the option plan.&#160; Options
granted have vesting periods ranging from 3 to 5 years.&#160; The Company received a total of $139,125 and
$339,000 upon the exercise of stock options for 17,000 and 56,500 shares for
the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2003 and 2002.&#160; There were no stock options exercised during the year ended
September&nbsp;30, 2001.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A reconciliation of the
Company&#146;s stock option activity, and related information, for the years ended
September&nbsp;30, 2003, 2002 and 2001 follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The exercise price of options at grant date has been made at fair
value.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">41</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='41',FILE='C:\jms\sbalaji\03-6288-1\task56840\6288-1-be.htm',USER='SBALAJI',CD='Dec 17 13:29 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .8in;text-indent:-.8in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Note
13.</font></b><b><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Segment
and Geographic Information</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company operates
primarily in the beverage alcohol industry in the United States.&#160; The Company reports its operating results in
five segments:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Bulk Alcohol Products (rum, citrus brandy,
citrus spirits, cane spirits, fortified citrus wine, purchased distilled
products and byproducts)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Premium Branded Spirits (primarily Cruzan
Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Bottling Operations (contract bottling
services and proprietary and private label products)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Vinegar and Cooking Wine (bulk vinegar, bulk
cooking wine, vinegar stock and proprietary and private label case goods)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Corporate Operations and Other (primarily
corporate related items).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The accounting policies of the reportable segments are the same as
those described in Note 1 to the Consolidated Financial Statements.&#160; The Company evaluates the performance of its
operating segments based on income before income taxes, equity in losses of
equity investee, interest income and expense. Material intersegment sales and
transfers have been eliminated.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Summarized financial information concerning the Company&#146;s reportable
segments is shown in the following table.&#160;
&#147;Corporate Operations and Other&#148; includes corporate related items and
the results of certain nonmaterial operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">42</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

and amortization and capital expenditures for the Company&#146;s operating segments
for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2003, 2002 and 2001 are as follows:</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">43</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Sales and operating income for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2003,
2002, and 2001 and identifiable assets as of the end of each period classified
by geographic area, were as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="95%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:95.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="40%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:40.46%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>

  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">United States</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.72%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="17%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:17.66%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">U. S. Virgin<br>
  Islands and<br>
  the Bahamas</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.72%;">
  <p style="font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

  2003:</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">

  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.34%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">78,742,549</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  </td>
